etymology.description: semantic: 氵(水) (shuǐ, "water") + phonetic: 隹(隹) (zhuī, "short-tailed bird") = sound component -> name of Huai River
etymology.interpretation: 淮(淮) (huái, "Huai River") combines 氵(水) (shuǐ, "water") to convey its association with a body of water, specifically a river, and 隹(隹) (zhuī, "short-tailed bird") to provide the phonetic element. Together, they represent the Huai River, which is a major waterway in China.

examples.chinese: 沿着淮河寻找诗意(沿著淮河尋找詩意)。
examples.english: Following the Huai River to seek poetic inspiration.

examples.chinese: 春风送暖时(春風送暖時)，淮河水面闪烁着银光(淮河水面閃爍著銀光)。
examples.pinyin: Chūnfēng sòng nuǎn shí, Huái hé shuǐmiàn shǎnshuò zhe yínguāng.
examples.english: When the spring breeze warms the air, the surface of the Huai River sparkles with silver light.

examples.chinese: 夜幕降临后(夜幕降臨後)，淮水流淌出古城的传说(淮水流淌出古城的傳說)。
examples.pinyin: Yèmù jiànglín hòu, Huái shuǐ liútǎng chū gǔchéng de chuánshuō.
examples.english: After dusk falls, the Huai waters flow out legends of the ancient city.
